intro: Zerumbet autranii, commonly known as the Madagascar ginger or Zerumbet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features rhizomatous stems and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and have a glossy surface. Zerumbet autranii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
